exam_details.subject: نظم ادارة قواعد البيانات (Database Management Systems)

questions.question: What does the below relational algebra expression return? σ DNO=5(EMPLOYEE)
options: First name, last name, and salary of all employees in the company.
First name, last name, and salary of employees working in department 5.
All attributes of employees in department 5.
Only the department numbers of all employees.
questions.correct_answer: All attributes of employees in department 5.

questions.question: What does the below relational algebra expression return? π FNAME,LNAME,SALARY (σ DNO=5(EMPLOYEE))
options: First name, last name, and salary of all employees in the company.
All attributes of employees in department 5.
Only the department numbers of all employees.
First name, last name, and salary of employees working in department 5.
questions.correct_answer: First name, last name, and salary of employees working in department 5.

questions.question: What does the selection (σ) operation do in relational algebra?
options: Removes duplicate tuples from a relation.
Chooses a subset of tuples based on a condition.
Rearranges tuples in a relation into a new order.
Merges two relations into one.
questions.correct_answer: Chooses a subset of tuples based on a condition.

questions.question: How does Relational Algebra help in database query optimization?
options: It forces all databases to use the same execution plan.
It replaces SQL queries entirely in modern databases.
It ensures that all queries return only one tuple as output.
It provides a mathematical foundation for rewriting queries in a more efficient way.
questions.correct_answer: It provides a mathematical foundation for rewriting queries in a more efficient way.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about the Projection (π) operation?
options: It filters tuples based on a condition.
It removes duplicate tuples and keeps only the specified attributes.
It combines two relations based on a join condition.
It produces a Cartesian Product of two relations.
questions.correct_answer: It removes duplicate tuples and keeps only the specified attributes.

questions.question: What is the main problem with using the Cartesian Product (X) in relational algebra?
options: It returns only distinct values from both relations.
It always removes duplicate rows.
It automatically filters only related records.
It produces too many meaningless tuples.
questions.correct_answer: It produces too many meaningless tuples.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Materialized Evaluation in query execution?
options: A) It evaluates multiple operations simultaneously without storing intermediate results.
B) It stores intermediate results as temporary relations before executing the next operation.
C) It eliminates the need for indexing in database queries.
D) It is used only for transactions, not for query optimization.
questions.correct_answer: B) It stores intermediate results as temporary relations before executing the next operation.

questions.question: Why is External Sorting needed in databases?
options: A) Because databases store data in sorted order by default.
B) Because sorting in memory is always slow.
C) Because the data is too large to fit in main memory.
D) Because external sorting reduces the number of queries needed.
questions.correct_answer: C) Because the data is too large to fit in main memory.

questions.question: Which factor most affects the performance of External Sorting?
options: A) The CPU processing speed
B) The number of available memory buffers.
C) The number of users running queries.
D) The complexity of SQL queries.
questions.correct_answer: B) The number of available memory buffers.

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using Pipelining over Materialization in query execution?
options: A) Pipelining always produces the result faster than any other method.
B) Pipelining increases the number of disk I/O operations, making query execution more reliable.
C) Pipelining eliminates the need for query optimization altogether.
D) Pipelining requires less memory by avoiding storing intermediate results.
questions.correct_answer: D) Pipelining requires less memory by avoiding storing intermediate results.

questions.question: Consider the following query: SELECT * FROM EMPLOYEE WHERE Age>30 AND City = 'New York'; There is an index on Age, but City is not indexed. What might happen during query execution?
options: A) The database will always use the Age index and filter City later.
B) The database will ignore the index and process both conditions together.
C) Since City has no index, the database might scan the entire table because filtering by Age alone is not enough.
D) The database will create a temporary index on City for better performance.
questions.correct_answer: A) The database will always use the Age index and filter City later.

questions.question: A database needs to sort a large file that does not fit in memory. The system has 10 memory pages available, and the file has 1000 pages. How many initial sorted runs will be created in the first phase of External Sort-Merge?
An SQL query first translated into which form before execution?
options: A) Machine code
B) Relational algebra
C) Binary data
D) Assembly language
questions.correct_answer: B) Relational algebra

questions.question: What is the main goal of query optimization in a DBMS?
options: A) To execute queries as fast as possible
B) To ensure queries always return correct results
C) To use as many indexes as possible
D) To minimize the use of SQL functions
questions.correct_answer: A) To execute queries as fast as possible

questions.question: Why do we apply SELECT and PROJECT operations before JOIN in heuristic optimization?
options: A) To increas the number of attributes in the result
B) To ensure all joins are performed
C) To minimize the size of intermediate results
D) To avoid Cartesian products
questions.correct_answer: C) To minimize the size of intermediate results

questions.question: What is the main disadvantage of a Cartesian product in query execution?
options: It requires a secondary index
It cannot be used with joins
It produces a large number of unnecessary tuples
D) It does not support sorting
questions.correct_answer: It produces a large number of unnecessary tuples

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a heuristic rule in query optimization?
options: A) Apply SELECT early
B) Apply PROJECT early
C) Perform Cartesian products before joins
D) Use the most restrictive conditions first
questions.correct_answer: C) Perform Cartesian products before joins

questions.question: What is the role of a query tree in query optimization?
options: A) It stores query results
B) It represents query execution steps
C) It executes queries directly
D) It sorts all database records
questions.correct_answer: B) It represents query execution steps

questions.question: How does heuristic optimization improve query performance?
options: A) By removing duplicate records
B) By rewriting SQL statements
C) By optimizing queries based on predefined rules
D) By storing a query result permanently
questions.correct_answer: C) By optimizing queries based on predefined rules

questions.question: The schedule in the following table (T1 reads X... T2 reads Y... T1 reads X...) is an example of ______ schedule.
options: A) Recoverable.
B) Nonrecoverable.
C) Serializable.
D) Serial.
questions.correct_answer: D) Serial.

questions.question: ______ keeps track of transaction operations.
options: A) Operating system.
B) System log
C) Database system.
D) Data.
questions.correct_answer: B) System log

questions.question: What is a transaction in a database system?
options: A) A logical unit of database processing
B) A single read operation
C) A backup copy of a database
D) A process that always modifies all records
questions.correct_answer: A) A logical unit of database processing

questions.question: In a multi-user database, transactions are processed:
options: A) Sequentially, one at a time
B) Only when no other transaction is running
C) Concurrently, with possible interleaving
D) Only when the database is offline
questions.correct_answer: C) Concurrently, with possible interleaving

questions.question: The schedule in the following table is an example of ______ problem.
options: Lost update.
Unrepeatable read.
Incorrect Summary.
Dirty Read.
questions.correct_answer: Lost update.

questions.question: What happens if a transaction is committed?
options: The database is restored
The transaction is aborted
The transaction is rolled back
All changes made by the transaction are permanent
questions.correct_answer: All changes made by the transaction are permanent

questions.question: If a transaction aborts, what should happen?
options: A) The database should be shut down
B) The operations already performed should be undone
C) The transaction should be committed
D) The transaction should retry automatically
questions.correct_answer: B) The operations already performed should be undone

questions.question: A serial schedule is one where:
options: A) All transactions execute at the same time
B) Transactions execute one after another without interleaving
C) Transactions do not use concurrency control
D) Transactions execute in random order
questions.correct_answer: B) Transactions execute one after another without interleaving

questions.question: The system log helps in:
options: A) Scheduling transactions
B) Monitoring user activities
C) Undoing or redoing transactions during failure recovery
D) Improving database indexing
questions.correct_answer: C) Undoing or redoing transactions during failure recovery

questions.question: A non-serial schedule:
options: A) Is always incorrect
B) Executes transactions without interleaving
C) May be serializable
D) Cannot be recovered
questions.correct_answer: C) May be serializable

questions.question: What is the main purpose of a multilevel index?
options: A) To increase data redundancy
B) To speed up searching
C) To store more data
D) To replace primary indexing
questions.correct_answer: B) To speed up searching

questions.question: What is a key advantage of hash indexing?
options: It organizes data hierarchically
It is better for ordered datasets
It supports fast lookup for specific values
It works best for range queries
questions.correct_answer: It supports fast lookup for specific values

questions.question: What type of database column benefits most from a bitmap index?
options: Columns with long text data
Columns used as primary keys
Columns with few distinct values
Columns with many unique values
questions.correct_answer: Columns with few distinct values

questions.question: When should a function-based index be used?
options: A) When sorting data in ascending order
B) When all queries use primary keys
C) When queries use expressions in WHERE clauses
D) When using simple SELECT * statements
questions.correct_answer: C) When queries use expressions in WHERE clauses

questions.question: What is a key advantage of using a multilevel index over a single-level index?
options: A) It speeds up search operations
B) It removes duplicate data
C) It requires no additional storage
D) It simplifies database structure
questions.correct_answer: B) It removes duplicate data

questions.question: What type of index is used at each level in a multilevel index?
options: A) Secondary index
B) Hash index
C) Bitmap index
D) Primary index
questions.correct_answer: D) Primary index

questions.question: What is the purpose of an index in a database?
options: A) To store data permanently
B) To speed up record retrieval
C) To replace the primary key
D) To prevent data duplication
questions.correct_answer: B) To speed up record retrieval

questions.question: A secondary index can be created on which type of field?
options: A) Only primary key
B) Only ordered fields
C) Any non-ordering field
D) Only foreign key
questions.correct_answer: C) Any non-ordering field

questions.question: Which statement is true about secondary indexes?
options: A) They are always sparse
B) They are based on the primary key
C) They can be created on non-ordering fields
D) They replace primary indexes
questions.correct_answer: B) They are based on the primary key

questions.question: What is a major drawback of secondary indexes?
options: A) They require additional storage space
B) They can only be created on primary keys
C) They do not improve performance
D) They make searching slower
questions.correct_answer: A) They require additional storage space

questions.question: Which index type is best suited for range queries?
options: A) Hash index
B) Bitmap index
C) Multilevel index
D) Sparse index
questions.correct_answer: C) Multilevel index
